poem:
"Misprint Morning"

Pedro is prime minister, not the king,
Katie Boulter sans the seeded ring.
In the tale of titans and slight trim,
Morning paper, a hymn of whims.
So correct me, amend my sight,
In a world of ink, where wrongs turn right.
In the grand scheme, quietly shows,
The story's different than what we suppose.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • Pedro Sánchez is Spain’s prime minister, not president as we described him in an editorial in some early editions (European elections 2024: Progressive parties must find a bold response to the threat of the radical right, 6 March, Journal, p2). • The tennis player Katie Boulter was not seeded for the Indian Wells tournament as an article stated (How brilliant Boulter found her winning formula, 5 March, p36). • Other recently". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Corrections and clarifications • Pedro Sánchez is Spain’s prime minister, not president as we described him in an editorial in some early editions (European elections 2024: Progressive parties must find a bold response to the threat of the radical right, 6 March, Journal, p2). • The tennis player Katie Boulter was not seeded for the Indian Wells tournament as an article stated (How brilliant Boulter found her winning formula, 5 March, p36). • Other recently
